content.description: Under the roof to the left of "Pink Salmon" look for the largest, lowest ledge you could possibly sit start on. Heel hook and make nice moves up through jugs. The jugs diminish to still-nice crimp rails (which are all salmon pink and look nicer than the massive jugs on the "pink salmon" problem to the right) which lead to the top lip of the roof. Hell hook, grab higher crimps over the lip, and stand up on the top of the roofs lip to say you have finished (dont attempt to top it out).

Im not sure if this can actually be "graded" 

 Hang from the bottom sit start hold, and campus the ledge filled face to the top lip for the mantle.

 Super fun
content.location: Same start as "Salmon" only with out feet.

content.description:
SS in the bottom center of the face. make sure as you ascend to try and stay to the left of the blackish, horizontal crack/seam/line. this acts as a divider between "Pink Salmon" and "Coho" 

  Start on the huge ledge at the bottom and climb straight up the overhang. heel hook and pull over the lip. finish with hands up high, and standing completely up on the edge of the boulder. you should be able to stand topped out using no hands at this point (don't actually try to top completely over this massive face without a rope please.) jump down to the lower boulder.
content.location: SS in the bottom center of the face. make sure as you ascend to try and stay to the left of the blackish, horizontal crack/seam/line. this acts as a divider between "Warm-Up" and "Coho"

content.description: SS to the right of the dark Horizontal line/seam. Start with your right hand on a sloper, left hand on a diagonal side-pull. pull up and bump up a right hand into a three finger flat daub. toss up a left hand to a ledge and follow out slim ledges to the top lip. trend to top out to the right and go in deep onto the top for the best top out hold ever
content.location: SS to the right of the dark Horizontal line/seam.

content.description: Climb "Spawn" and than continue into the upper diagonal rail that streaks up the upper boulder face for 6 feet. Climb directly up the face above the roof (dont go left) useing the rail, and then grab the top of the boulder when it dips back. Gain small feet on the face and reach back for a pinch. scramble over the face after the top out and walk off happy to be alive.

the Salmon roof is loaded with mega quality jug rails from bottom to top-out and the warm-up problem that goes with it couldn't be more perfect to start the day with: "Pink Salmon" (V-1).   this wall is also super lengthy to climb out of (15 feet), but the landing is rarely over 5 feet off the ground thanks to the angle of the stone "porch/patio" below it. there is also a great quality line on the right of the face called "coho" (v-3)   -Note-   The "dark seam" that vertically separates the face of the warm up roof (can be clearly viewed in the pictures) is a divider between "Pink Salmon"(v-1) and "coho"(v-3).
